If you are driving between these states take the M31 inland which should take you just under 9 hours(traffic depending)

Travel Directions : Canberra-Jervis-Bay

Location: Canberra-Jervis-Bay

Activity: Travel

Unfortunately there is no direct public transport between Canberra and Jervis bay so the best mode of transport is to hire a car for a few day to travel between Canberra and Sydney via Jervis Bay. The journey is around 3 hours to Jervis Bay.

Travel Directions : Jervis-Bay-Canberra

Location: Jervis-Bay-Canberra

Activity: Travel

Unfortunately there is no direct public transport between Canberra and Jervis bay so the best mode of transport is to hire a car for a few days to travel between Canberra and Sydney via Jervis Bay. The journey is around 3 hours to Jervis Bay.

DAY 24 : Huskissons Bay

View Image

DAY 24

Location: Jervis Bay

Activity: Huskissons Bay

Jervis Bay is a coastal town around 3 hours South of Sydney. The best place to stay is Huskissons Bay as it offers the most shops and restaurants. The majority of the surrounding is either a National park or secluded beach. The best part about Jervis Bay is the fact its so private, the beaches offer lots of space and are rarely busy, even on public holidays.

Once you have arrived at Huskissons Bay grab some breakfast or lunch at one of the local boutique Cafes before heading over to the peninsula. Huskissons beach is very unique as you can see it but you cant reach it from the main town.

The beach is a peninsula so you have to drive back out of town and around to the peninsula. There are very little waves in the harbour which means its a great place to paddle board or kayak. In the afternoon head out to one of the many recommended hidden beaches in the area, for example Honeymoon Bay, Greenfield Beach or Green Patch. Honeymoon Bay offers a very narrow stretch of beach but its a great place to relax as the bay has almost no waves meaning you can relax in the waste height waters or go a little further out for some snorkelling.

DAY 25 : Beach Day- Worlds whitest beach

View Image

DAY 25

Location: Jervis Bay

Activity: Beach Day- Worlds whitest beach

Head straight to Hyams beach for the day. This is the Guiness Book of Records whitest beach in the world! The sand is so incredibly clean and white that it actually sqeaks as you walk across it. Hyams beach is almost 3km long so you will have lots of privacy. The waves here are pretty high and you can hear them crashing before you see the beach.

Head in to Huskissons, just a 15 minute drive away to grab some lunch or dinner over looking the bay at Club Jervis Bay with 3 different restaurants to choose from or a few others dotted along the main street.

DAY 26 : Beach Day and Coastal Walk

View Image

DAY 26

Location: Sydney

Activity: Beach Day and Coastal Walk

Bondi to Coogee coastal walk 1.5hours If youre not pushed for time Id recommend stopping at a few different beaches and make a day of it. Some underrated favourites are Gordons Bay and Tamara. Youll also want to do the Bondi Icebergs (sea pools) as its a bit of a tourist spot. Bondi and Coogee are the largest of the beaches and you will find restaurants for breakfast or lunch at either end. Coogee Bay beach Hotel has a great atmosphere for afternoon drinks.

You will find a cafe at Tamara that does Milkshakes and light lunches or smoothies and fish and chips from the beach hut at Bronte.

Coogee Pavilion is a good spot for a night out if youre looking for a dance floor!

DAY 27 : Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge Climb

View Image

DAY 27

Location: Sydney

Activity: Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge Climb

Sydney Opera House tour.

Tickets can be bought for $42. The tour is roughly an hour long and will teach you about the architecture of the building and some of the iconic performances that have taken place there. If this isnt your thing you can still take a walk along the Quay and take pictures of this hotspot as well as the Harbour Bridge. Sydney Opera House

Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb.

Its a little pricey but if Its been on your bucket list and you only plan on being here once then Id say its worth it. I did the twilight tour which I recommend. It takes around 3.5 hours. The starting price for this climb is $270 however it can get a bit more expensive depending on the time of day you decide to book and also weekends vs weekdays. Harbour Bridge Climb

Lunch/dinner at the Opera house. Considering the location the Opera bar is really well priced. Great cocktails and a beautiful backdrop. Opera House Bar

DAY 28 : Spit to Manly Coastal Walk

View Image

DAY 28

Location: Sydney

Activity: Spit to Manly Coastal Walk

The walk takes between 2.5-3hours and the terrain is overall pretty flat with a hand full of small inclines. You can take either the 178 or 180 bus from Wynyard station (check this using google maps before you leave as alternate bus routes may be available depending on the time of day) to Spit West Reserve I.e the start of the Spit bridge. The coastal walk starts on the seaboard side of the bridge.(walk across the bridge and the path is on the left hand side. Its a fairly easy walk but wear walking shoes as its 10km. Also make sure you take plenty of water as there is only 1 cafe along the path, around 30-45mins from the start. The walk has lots of beautiful beaches and view points across the harbour.

At the end of the walk you will arrive at Manly Wharf. I recommend either the Manly Hotel or the Manly Skiff for lunch. Both are on the waterfront and have good food/cocktails. If youre looking for something cheaper try Bettys Burgers at the Ferry terminal. Spend the afternoon at the Manly Main beach (This is not the beach you see when you first arrive, its a few minutes walk) or shop along the highstreet. There are loads of great bikini stores here.

Take the Ferry from Manly wharf back to Circular Quay. If you go on a Sunday travel is capped at $2.80. Ferry takes around 30minutes.

Manly Skiff

Manly Wharf Hotel

Betty's Burgers

DAY 29 : Manly Day Trip

View Image

DAY 29

Location: Sydney

Activity: Manly Day Trip

Head down to Circular Quay to the Ferry Terminal where you can catch a Ferry to Manly. The Ferry across the Harbour is a popular way to see the landmarks. You can sit on the top deck to make the most of the view and photo opportunities. The Ferry takes roughly 25 minuets and depart every 20-30 minutes.

You will need an Opal card to travel on the Manly Ferry which varies from $7-9 depending on when you travel. It's best to go on a Sunday travel is capped at $2.80.

You will arrive at Manly Wharf where you will find restaurants, bars and a few shops. I recommend either the Manly Hotel or the Manly Skiff for lunch. Both are on the waterfront and have good food/cocktails. If youre looking for something cheaper try Bettys Burgers at the Ferry terminal.

Spend the day at the Manly Main beach (This is not the beach you see when you first arrive, its a few minutes walk through the highstreet) or you can shop along the highstreet. There are loads of great beach clothes and bikini stores here including the imfamous Budgy Smugglers store. You could also walk around to Shelley beach which is a much smaller and quieter spot.

Have drinks at the New Brighton Hotel rooftop overlooking Manly main beach to finish off the evening before catching the ferry back to Circular Quay.

Manly Skiff

Manly Wharf Hotel

Betty's Burgers

DAY 30 : Blue Mountains Day Trip

View Image

DAY 30

Location: Sydney

Activity: Blue Mountains Day Trip

Blue mountains day trip. Visit Wentworth falls and 3 sisters rocks as these are the main tourist spots. You can get a train into the Blue Mountains from Central station and explore these places via a self guided Hop on hop off tour that can show you around the Blue Mountains via a bus or the skyrailway. Blue Mountains Explorer bus and scenic world pass

Or alternatively you can book a guided tour to pick you up from Sydney. This includes the three sisters rock, the scenic sky railway and a guided bush walk as well as a lunch. Blue Mountains Day trip from Sydney

DAY 31 : Taronga Zoo Day Trip

View Image

DAY 31

Location: Sydney

Activity: Taronga Zoo Day Trip

You can make your way to Taronga Zoo either by bus or ferry depending where your based in the City.

I recommend taking the Ferry from Circular Quay directly to Taronga Zoo, you can only do this if you have also purchased a ticket that allows you access to the Skycar as the Skycar will pick you up from the Ferry terminal and take you over the top of the Zoo enclosures to the entrance of the Zoo.

Its a great way to start you Zoo experience as you can see lots of the animals roaming their enclosures

If you have not rebooked tickets or got access to the Skycar then you can catch a bus from Wynyard station that will take you over the Harbour Bridge and drop you at the entrance.

Taronga Zoo has a cafe and also a large restaurant that serves hot food such as burgers and chips or fish and chips, as well as ice cream and light snacks.

Tickets are normally around XXX and can be purchased online at You can also purchase experiences such as behind the scenes tours with Australian animals or even an overnight stay in the animal kingdom.

DAY 32 : Cronulla

View Image

DAY 32

Location: Sydney

Activity: Cronulla

Spend a day in one of Sydneys most affluent beach side suburbs, Cronulla. Cronulla is less than an hour from Central station. You can catch the T4 line directly to Cronulla and its a short 5 minute walk to the South Cronulla Beach. Cronulla is a great spot for a beach day, there are lots of beachfront cafes as well as locker-rooms.

Spend the morning relaxing at Cronulla South Beach before starting the 4km beach walk track. Follow the Coastal path south and walk the loop around the Peninsula and end up back at South Beach.

The coastal track has lots of secluded beach openings if youre looking for a more private spot to enjoy the beach.

Once youre back in town there are lots of great food spots to try out. If youre looking for a feast try out Milky Lane, the menu is full of feel good food, burgers, every kind of loaded fries, enormous thickshakes and cocktails. If youre looking for something a little lighter grab a toastie or a salad from Barefoot on the Beach.

DAY 33 : Sydney Harbour Cruise

View Image

DAY 33

Location: Sydney

Activity: Sydney Harbour Cruise

Spend a little more time on the Harbour by taking a Sydney Harbour Cruise. There are lots of different cruises that operate so there are plenty to choose from depending on what you taste is. There are options for High tea, 3 course dining or buffets lunches with bubbles. Some of the more popular cruises are with the below companies:

captain Cook Cruises

Sydney Harbour Lunch Cruises

Sydney Harbour Cruise

If youre travelling over New Year I highly recommend are boat cruise to get the best view of the fireworks.

Finish off your luxury lunch/dinner with a cocktail at one of the many famous spots in Circular Quay such as Cafe Sydney, Opera Bar or Aria Restaurant Sydney.

DAY 34 : Jet Boating on Sydney Harbour

View Image

DAY 34

Location: Sydney

Activity: Jet Boating on Sydney Harbour

Jet Boating is not just an extreme Watersport, its also a great way to see Sydney Harbour. There are a few different companies that run Jet boats on the harbour, standard prices across the companies is $85pp however they often offer discounts up to 40% off so check all the companies for the best rates.

Jet boats are designed to glide along the top of the water at high speed. Youll be doing 360 degree spins up and down the harbour dodging landmarks.

Once you finished exploring Sydney Harbour head to the Rocks markets. The markets are open Friday-Sunday until 5pm. The Rocks has some of the oldest pubs in Sydney amongst the upmarket restaurants and street food stools, this is why its such a popular spot, It has something for everyone.

If youre looking for a bar with a view head to Squires Landing for some drinks and bar snacks.

DAY 35 : Sea Life Aquarium

View Image

DAY 35

Location: Sydney

Activity: Sea Life Aquarium

Sea Life Aquarium is located in Darling Harbour. The doors open from 10am and you should allow around 2hours to walk around. If youre looking for a more interactive experience you can book special experiences such as feeding the penguins, private dining or even extreme shark diving. Entry to the aquarium starts from $48 per adult, however they often have discounts up to 20% online.

Spend the afternoon eating and drinking in Darling Harbour. The restaurants have happy hour from 3pm-6pm every day. Most venues have $5 beers and $10 cocktails as well as cheaper food deals during this time. If your looking for a nice setting on the Water try Cyren for cocktails and the best pizzas. If youre looking for something a little more lively head over to Pontoon Bar where the tables will clear to create a dance floor.

If your in Darling Harbour on a Saturday night check online to see if the fireworks are happening as theres a good chance youll be able to see them at 9pm.

DAY 36 : Watsons Bay

View Image

DAY 36

Location: Sydney

Activity: Watsons Bay

Watsons Bay is a beach spot on the Eastern Peninsula of Sydney Harbour. You can get to Watsons Bay via Ferry from Circular Quay, they run roughly every half an hour. Use your opal card to tap on and off.

Watsons bay main beach is a quiet strip of beach right next to a beautiful park, which is ideal for families. If youre looking for a picturesque and Instagramable beach then head around to Camp Cove Bay. Its a narrow beach with waist height water and no waves and boats docked just off the shore. Its is a great place to relax but I advised you get there early if you want to spread out on the beach as it is quite narrow and can get quite busy.

If youre looking for a place to eat head to Watsons Bay Hotel for Cocktails, music and an all round great atmosphere.

DAY 37 : The Yacht Social

View Image

DAY 37

Location: Sydney

Activity: The Yacht Social

The Yacht Social is an event held every weekend over the summer months. 8 yachts head out to the Harbour to create one big boat party. The boats all join in a ring and cover the centre with inflatables. Its the ultimate day drinking trip.

Tickets start from $125pp and will need to be booked in advance, although you may be able to get some last minute tickets via the Yacht social Facebook group . You can choose different standards of boats depending on the budget you have. All boats are BYOB and you can bring food for the BBQs also.

Yacht Social boats arrive back at the port around 4pm and if you havent had enough partying for one day, head to the Eastern Beaches to continue, starting at Coogee Bay Beach Hotel.

DAY 38 : Sydney Cricket Ground and Entertainment Quarter

View Image

DAY 38

Location: Sydney

Activity: Sydney Cricket Ground and Entertainment Quarter

Sydney Cricket Ground is a popular spot to watch Cricket, NRL or AFL games. Watch the Sydney Swans or the Sydney Roosters in a home game by checking the match days here. https://www.scgt.nsw.gov.au/sydney-cricket-ground/whats-on/ You can get here by taking the Lightrail from Central station to Moore Park which is roughly 14 minutes.

Sydney Cricket Ground is right around the corner from The Entertainment Quarter which is a great place to socialise before or after a game. There are more than 20 eaterys from cafes to restaurants and even a Barvarian Beerhouse.

The Entertainment Quarter is oftening hosting gigs, Showgrounds or markets so check whats on and make a day of it.

DAY 39 : Hunter Valley Day Trip from Sydney

View Image

DAY 39

Location: Sydney

Activity: Hunter Valley Day Trip from Sydney

The Hunter Valley is NSWs famous Winery region roughly 3 hours North of Sydney. You can book day trips from Sydney that stop at 3-4 different wineries as well as the chocolate shop. A popular choice is the Hunter Valley Wine Tasting Tours

The tour will pick you up from a central location between 6:45am and 7:30am and will drop you back between 6pm and 6:30pm. You can also chose to taste some craft beers for an additional cost.

Tours start from $120 if booked online or $145 if you want to include a 2 course lunch. You can order lunch separately on the day if you prefer.

DAY 40 : Walk around the City

View Image

DAY 40

Location: Sydney

Activity: Walk around the City

Spend the day exploring the City. Start at the Queen Victoria Building and Pitt Street Mall for some shopping. From here you can walk Station for some shopping for some City shopping. Make a final stop at a Woolworths or Coles supermarket and pick up some snacks for a picnic.

From here you can walk through the top of Hyde Park and towards the Royal Botanical Gardens. This should take you roughly 30-45 minutes depending on how far in to the park you want to go. Pick a spot and stop for an afternoon picnic.

Once youve taken in all the Botanical Gardens beauty keeping walking towards Mrs Macquaries Chair on the Peninsula for the best view of the Opera and Harbour Bridge together.

Head back to your accommodation to get dressed up before heading to O Bar in the City for a spectacular 360 degree view of Sydney from the sky. You can choose to dine in (we recommend booking in advance) or just head to the bar for some bar snacks and a cocktail.

If youre looking for a more relaxed environment check out the Ivy Pool Bar, a rooftop bar that has pizzas, salads and cocktails. They often host themed nights during the week so check them out online before hand. And dont be afraid to go for a swim!

Both of these restaurant's are a short walk from Wynyard station.

DAY 41 : Kayaking on the Harbour and Luna Park

View Image

DAY 41

Location: Sydney

Activity: Kayaking on the Harbour and Luna Park

Kayaking on the Harbour is a great way to see all the Landmarks. Sydney by Kayak offer different types of Kayaking tours such as a Sunrise tour, a Harbour clean up, a fitness tour or a private couples tour. Prices vary from $50-$380 depending on the length of tour and which tour you choose.

As part of your Harbour Kayaking Tour youre bound to catch a glimpse of Luna Park so why not take a walk across the Harbour Bridge and enjoy the view and then make your way to the park to enjoy the rides.

You can purchase unlimited ride tickets from $43 online or alternatively just pay as you go for the rides you want to go on. Entry to the park is free so you can walk around and play the carnival games.

Luna park has a few places to eat where you can get burgers, artisan pizzas and ice creams.

DAY 42 : Sydney Museums

View Image

DAY 42

Location: Sydney

Activity: Sydney Museums

The Museum of Sydney shows you how Sydney has changed over the years. The Sydney Museum is a modern museum built over and around the remains of Australias first Government House. The Museum of Sydney celebrates the people and events that have shaped the character and soul of this city.$15.00. Open Daily 10:00 17:00. The Museum is on the corner of Philip & Bridge Street.

Learn about how the convicts lived in the World Heritage listed Hyde Park Barracksh. A fascinating look into transportation and a nation built on a convict past. Modern Sydney is built on convict foundations on convict labour, skills and stories. 50,000 convicts passed through its gates. Entrance is free however if you want an audio tour there is an additional cost. Opening times are 10:00 17:00 everyday.

Each year, Australians nation-wide commemorate Anzac Day on 25 April. The Anzac Memorial , located a few minute walk from our hotel in Hyde Park, is a place of commemoration and remembrance of the service and sacrifice of Australian men and women in war and peacekeeping activities since 1914. The Memorial is open every day from 09.00 to 17:00. Entry to the Memorialis free of charge, though donations are welcome.

The Australian Museum is in Hyde Park. The museum shows you Australia over time, dinosaurs and their relatives , Earth Science and much more. The Australian Museum is open 09.30 to 17:00. Tickets cost $15.00 for the permanent exhibition and $23.00 if you also want to visit the popup exhibitions.

At the Maritime Museum you can climb aboard real-life tall ships, warships and a submarine and explore temporary exhibitions all centred on Australia and its relationship with the sea. The Museum is open 09:00 17:00 with last boarding time for vessels being 16:10. Located on Darling Harbour (The Prymont Side), the museum is a 25 minute walk from Town Hall. You can take A Ferry from Circular Quay or walk in 30 mins. A Big Ticket costs $25.00 and includes access to everything.

DAY 43 : Explore the Arts

View Image

DAY 43

Location: Sydney

Activity: Explore the Arts

If you are into your modern art you can visit the Museum of Contemporary Art located at Circular Quay. Opening times are 10:00am 17:00pm. On Wednesday nights throughout the year, the whole Gallery remains open until 9pm. General Admission is free to the public however popup exhibitions are an additional cost.

The Art Gallery ofNSWis one of Australias leading art museums. See the collection of Australian, Aboriginal, European, Asian and contemporary art. Located within the Domain Gardens. Admission to the Gallery is free. Temporary exhibitions have a cost. Opening hours, every day 10:00 until 17:00. On Wednesday nights throughout the year, the whole Gallery remains open until 9pm.

The Manly Art Gallery and Museum is the oldest metropolitan regional gallery in NSW and the centre for the visual arts on the Northern Beaches. THe Museum is free entry and opening times are Tuesday Sunday 10am 3pm.

Travel Directions : Sydney-Byron

Location: Sydney-Byron

Activity: Travel

Greyhound buses which run twice a day take 12 and a half hours. Average price is $100-175 again depending on what day/season you are travelling.

Flights from Sydney to Coolangata are on average $120-200, flights take roughly 1 hour.

If you are looking to get to Byron or the Gold Coast from Coolangata Airport the Skybus operates every 2 hours with a one way trip at just $28 for the 55minute journey which is much cheaper than any of the taxi's available. It's worth checking the timetable in advance as you may find yourself just missing a shuttle and having to wait 2 hours. Sky Bus

If youre looking for something cheaper you can get a train from Sydney central station direct to Casino station just south of Byron Bay, trains run twice a day and take 11 and a half hours. From here you can get a bus to Byron Bay which takes just over 1 hour, however these buses only run every 4 hours so make sure the timings add up before committing to this route.

DAY 44 : Kayaking and Cocktails

View Image

DAY 44

Location: Byron Bay

Activity: Kayaking and Cocktails

Get settled in to life in Byron Bay by getting to know the area. Spend the morning browsing the boutique shops filled with a mixture of vintage and surfing styles. The one of a kind shops here will make you want to spend spend spend!

Kayak with Dolphins with the team at Cape Byron Kayaks , who are located a short walk to the right of Main Beach. The team are fantastic and will do their absolute best to find some marine life but you have to remember the time of year you go can affect what you will be able to see. You may manage to see a pod of Dolphins and some Turtles but best of all you could catch a glimpse of some Whales. Honestly a travel highlight!

Head back into town for a lunch stop at Miss Margarita's a highly popular Mexican restaurant which, as you can probably guess, does great margarita's! There can be a waiting time of up to an hour and they don't take reservations(which goes for most places in Byron) so I'd recommend a late lunch/ early dinner around 4-5pm in order to secure a table. Or you could even just head there for happy hour which is between 4pm-6pm and sip all the cocktails before dinner that evening.

Accommodation Tip: The Bayhaven Lodge has adorable rooms, some of which have access to the garden. My room was spotless and decorated beautifully in a Byron style, the Bayhaven Lodge is around a 5 minute walk to the main road of shops and restaurants in Byron Bay and it's in an ideal location for anyone travelling with a car or van as there is free on street parking just 100metres away. Alternatively if your looking at hostels Nomads has really spacious rooms with ensuite bathrooms.

DAY 45 : Wategoes Beach

View Image

DAY 45

Location: Byron Bay

Activity: Wategoes Beach

Start with a breakfast yoghurt and smoothie at Sweet Byron on the corner of Jonsons and Lawsons street. Little tip if you can guess the weight of your frozen yogurt it will be free! Then make your way to Wategos Beach via Lighthouse Road. The walk to Wategos Beach is around 3km and will take roughly 45 minutes or just 7 minutes to drive from Main Beach. There is limited free parking so we recommend getting here before 10am or alternatively head just up the hill from the beach where you will find on street free parking. If you are looking to park just off of the beach you should again arrive early and be prepared to pay for parking that will be limited to a maximum of 4hours.

Wategos Beach sits just under the Lighthouse surrounded by some of Byrons most prestigious properties. You'll find some serious #HouseGoals here and will probably start planning your retirement. You can make use of the public BBQ and picnic benches on the grass to the left hand side of the beach or maybe grab a coffee and from Soul Kitchen cafe. The beach is just perfect, the sand is pristine and the waters are warm and shallow meaning you can wade out and play with a ball or frisbee before the bank drops off.

Finish off the day with sunset at The Wreck, located just off of the Main Beach in Byron, whilst listening to the performers in Apex Park, you'll find lots of street performers in Byron and this is a great spot to sit and relax amongst them. Once the sun has set head to The Balcony for cocktails and dinner.

Tip: The Balcony has different offers each night of the week so do a little research and you may find some great deals.

DAY 46 : Sunrise at the Lighthouse and Surf lesson

View Image

DAY 46

Location: Byron Bay

Activity: Sunrise at the Lighthouse and Surf lesson

Set your alarm clock for EARLY! (Google sunrise, roughly 5:30am). Head up to the Lighthouse for sunrise, it's so worth the morning hike for a chance to see this view. Byron Bay Lighthouse is located at Cape Byron, the most Easterly point of Australia. From the top you are likely to see all kinds of sea life, such as Turtles, Dolphins and even Whales passing by from up here.

Book a surf lesson at Lennox head with Mojo Surf . If you head to Mojo Surf on Fletcher street they can book you in for a morning or afternoon session running at either 8:30am or 12:30pm. Lennox head has a huge stretch of beach and perfect conditions for learning to surf. The lessons are around 3-4 hours so you'll be finishing around lunch time but before heading back to Byron you need to check out Lake Ainsworth just off of the beach and carpark.

Lake Ainsworth is a tea tree lake which essentially means the oils from the surrounding tea trees seep in to the lake turning the water so dark it's almost impossible to clearly see your own hands under the water. The effects of this however means your hair and skin feel smooth and silky even after stepping out of the salty sea. The water is so warm it's almost like bath water. It's a beautiful place to relax until sunset with some lilo's and a few drinks before heading off to the next spot on your east coast adventure.

Round off the day at main beach before heading to Cheeky Monkeys for a night of super cheap happy hour drinks and dancing on tables!

Tip: Check their websites as they often have theme nights or quiz nights. We managed to win the quiz and got some free surfing lessons which was a perfect plan for the rest of our stay.

DAY 47 : Waterfalls

View Image

DAY 47

Location: Byron Bay

Activity: Waterfalls

Head out to Killen Falls, it's around a half an hour drive and then just a 10 minute walk to the waterfall. Make sure you are in comfortable shoes as it can be a little slippery. The waterfall sits over a cave meaning you can walk behind it or set up in the shade whilst you're swimming beneath the waterfall.

The second stop is Minyon Falls. Minyon falls is a 45 minute drive North of Killen falls in Nightcap National Park. The waterfall itself is 100m and you can take an 8km circuit to see the top and bottom of the waterfall. However one thing to take in to consideration is the weather, If you take the 40 minute drive on a nice hot day in the middle of summer you may find one very dried out waterfall. Which could be a little frustrating, however at the top of the waterfall there were a few pockets of water that are deep enough to use as plunge pools overlooking the national park that don't should still be full.

You must stay away from the edge at the top of the waterfall as the rocks can be slippery and this could be extremely dangerous

.

DAY 48 : Theme Parks

View Image

DAY 48

Location: Gold Coast

Activity: Theme Parks

You can choose from Wet'n' Wild, Movie World and Sea World depending on what you enjoy starting from $89 per adult or alternatively you can buy a 3 day pass which will get you access to all 3 parks for $139pp. The parks open at 9:30am however the rides don't start until 10am so it's handy to get there early and get in line for the first ride of the day to make sure you can do as much as possible.

To get to Movie World and Wet 'n' Wild catch the train to either Coomera (if coming from Gold Coast) or Helensvale (if coming from Brisbane) station and transfer to bus route TX7. Getting to the theme park is easy with TX7 bus service which leaves Helensvale every 15 minutes, daily from 9:00am 11.30am.

You can get to Sea World by catching the 705 bus from the corner of Ferny Avenue and Palm Avenue in Surfers Pardise. The bus will take roughly 15 minutes to get to the park and it will then be a 8-10 minute walk to the entrance. Buses run roughly every 15 minutes.

All 3 theme parks have restaurants or cafes so you will be able to buy food and drinks throughout the day.

If you are looking to get to Byron or the Gold Coast from the Coolangatta Airport the Skybus operates every 2 hours with a one way trip at just $28 for the 55minute journey which is much cheaper than any of the taxi's available. It's worth checking the timetable in advance as you may find yourself just missing a shuttle and having to wait 2 hours. Sky Bus

DAY 49 : Burleigh Heads and Currumbin National Park

View Image

DAY 49

Location: Gold Coast

Activity: Burleigh Heads and Currumbin National Park

Stop at Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary on your way from Byron up to the Gold Coast or Brisbane. You can visit Currumbin wildlife centre to cuddle a koala and feed the karangaroos. general Admission is $65 for an adult and this includes a photo holding a Koala.

If you just want to explore the loacl town you can visit Currumbin which is a small surf town, again with pretty beaches and coffee shops.

In the evening head North to Burleigh Heads for some nightlife. It has a great sunset spot on the water so soak up all the beach vibes.

Burleigh Heads is the trendiest spot on the Gold Coast. Beautiful yet quiet beaches and a great atmosphere. Burleigh is a great spot to spend a night and relax mid way through your trip. Spend the evening at Burleigh Heads Pavillion to catch sunset with a cocktail after a day of relaxing at the beach or exploring at the Wildlife Sanctuary.

DAY 50 : Whale Watching Tour

View Image

DAY 50

Location: Gold Coast

Activity: Whale Watching Tour

Whales migrate up and down the East coast of Australia along the coastline and the Gold Coast is a perfect place to spot them. Book a Sea World tour Sea World tour to catch a close up glimpse of the whales. Tours depart 3 times a day and run for 2 and a half hours. The boats have 3 decks and an onboard bar for refreshments. In the unlikely case that you are unable to see any Whales you will get a free return ticket.(Recommend doing this on one of your first days on the Gold Coast incase you do need to rebook)

Tickets start at $89per adult however they are often advertising discounts online.

Once youre back on land and beaming from your day at sea, book a table at Four Winds 360 restaurant. Four Winds is a 360 revolving restaurant that offers buffet lunches and dinners starting from $65 with an ever changing view.

DAY 51 : Surfers Paradise - Sea Kayaking to South Stradbroke Island

View Image

DAY 51

Location: Surfers Paradise

Activity: Surfers Paradise - Sea Kayaking to South Stradbroke Island

Book a Chill-out tour with Seaway Kayaking Tours

The tours are roughly 4 hours and you will kayak to South Stradbroke Island to enjoy a bush walk before continue kayaking to Wave Break Island. At wave break Island there is an exclusive chill out spot where you will be able to snorkel, sunbathe and even try some stand up paddle boarding before heading back to Surfers Paradise.

This tour is $99 for an adult however you may be able to find discounts online. If you are looking for a shorter tour theres also some shorter and cheaper options on their website.

Spend the rest of the afternoon at Surfers Paradise Beach and the head to Cavill Ave to one of the many alfresco restaurants. This is also where you will find the Instagramable Surfers Paradise sign.

Surfers Paradise is known for its Nightlife, youll find the strip on Orchid Avenue where there are loads of bars and night clubs that you cannot miss. There will be promoters walking up and down the strip offering entry for $10-20 and vouchers for drinks in different nightclubs so take your pick. Its difficult to recommend a top nightclub as taste in music will vary so see what takes your fancy on the night.

DAY 52 : Surfers Paradise- SkyPoint

View Image

DAY 52

Location: Surfers Paradise

Activity: Surfers Paradise- SkyPoint

Head to Australias only beachside Observation Deck and the tallest residential building in the world. You can go up to the 77th floor and see the 360 degree view of Surfers Paradise. Tickets are $27pp for entry to the skydeck where you will get a view of the city and the beach.

You can also eat at the Skypoint Bistro + Bar , they have an Australian menu with gluten free and vegan options as well as afternoon tea for two.

If youre a bit of an adrenaline junkie then you will want to book a climb to the summit. Australias highest external bridge climb stands at 270m above sea level! Tickets start at a really reasonable $77pp for a day time climb, however for $87pp you will receive a $20 food voucher the the sky point bistro so you can enjoy lunch with a view after working up an appetite.

Surfers Paradise is definitely your place for night life. Youll find lots of clubs to party all night on Orchid Avenue. Most of these clubs have an entry fee of $10-20 and drinks can be quite expensive but you will notice club reps outside most of these places and youll be able to ask around to find the best deals.

DAY 53 : Explore the City

View Image

DAY 53

Location: Brisbane

Activity: Explore the City

You can get to Brisbane by public transport anywhere along the Gold Coast or Sunshine Coast. If you've spent most of your trip exploring beaches and the great outdoors you could spend the day in the City. Head to Queens Street Mall for some shopping and maybe get some lunch at Jimmy's on the Mall. Jimmy's is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and offers live music and a great cocktail menu.

Then maybe take a river cruise to check out the city from the water. Sightseeing River Cruises start from just $30. If you're looking for nightlife head to Fortitude Valley for bars and nightclubs.

DAY 54 : South Bank

View Image

DAY 54

Location: Brisbane

Activity: South Bank

Take a walk along Victoria Bridge towards South Bank where you'll find the Brisbane Sign. The brightly coloured BRISBANE can't be missed as it's often attracting the attention of tourists who are looking to get a picture standing between the letters. Stop for a quick photo to send to your friends and family to let them know you've arrived in Brisabane and the keep walking towards the Brisbane Wheel. The wheel is 200ft high, giving you a great view over Brisbane River. The tickets are $22 each for 4 loops.

Continue along South Bank to find the markets. The markets have a variety of clothes, artwork, jewellery and food stools and they are open Friday to Sunday. Once you've finished browsing you can grab some food and cocktails at South Bank Social, overlooking the man-made beach. South Bank Social has a great menu and perfect for afternoon cocktails as they often have some form of happy hour deals as well as live entertainment on weekends.

DAY 55 : Botanical Gardens picnic and Nightlife

View Image

DAY 55

Location: Brisbane

Activity: Botanical Gardens picnic and Nightlife

Head to the Botanical Gardens from the City, its roughly a 17 minute walk from Central station. Make a stop at Coles or Woolworths on the way to grab some snacks for a picnic in the park. If you are visiting on a Sunday the Botanical gardens has riverside markets between 8am - 3pm so you may be able to grab some treats here too.

Relax in the sun and enjoy a walk around the park before heading to Howard Smith Wharves for a late afternoon drink. Howard Smith Wharves has 12 different restaurants and bars to choose from. Pick a riverside location to enjoy the evening atmosphere before moving on to the nightlife in Fortitude Valley.

Depending on how the night goes youll find yourself either boogying in a nightclub or sipping cocktails in a rooftop bar. So take your pick from some of the options below.

The Beat Mega Club

The Zoo

Cargo Brisbane

Sixteen Antlers

Eleven Rooftop Bar

Next Hotel

DAY 56 : Eat street Brisbane

View Image

DAY 56

Location: Brisbane

Activity: Eat street Brisbane

Eat Street has to be one of the best food markets on the East Coast, with over 70 different vendors selling all different cuisines. Eat street also has bars and retail vendors too. Its a little way out of the City but definitely worth it to get a food fix youve been craving you can make it a full day out of eating drinking and shopping or just head here in the evening for something sweet, dinner and drinks.

From the City you can catch a train to Teneriffe station which takes roughly 9mins. You may be able to get there by bus or walking also depending where you are staying. From here you will need to take a Ferry to Northshore Hamilton Ferry Terminal. If you have purchased a go card this ferry will cost roughly $3.60 however you can also purchase a single ticket from the machine for $4.90.

Take cash with you just to be on the safe side as some street vendors dont accept card. There are ATM machines onsite however they may charge a fee. There is also a $3 entry fee per person which may be required in cash.

Opening hours are Friday and Saturday 4pm to 10pm, Sunday 12 Noon to 8pm.

DAY 57 : Kangaroo Cliffs

View Image

DAY 57

Location: Brisbane

Activity: Kangaroo Cliffs

Kangaroo Point Cliffs are located just across the river from the City and there are a number of different busses you can get from the City that will take roughly 25mins. This is a great spot to get some pictures of the City skyline.

If youre feeling adventurous the you can book a rock climbing or abseiling experience with Epic Adventures. Prices start from $100 however they often have discounts online or on their website for up to 40% off or 2 for 1 if youre travelling with a friend.

DAY 58 : Mount Coot-tha

View Image

DAY 58

Location: Brisbane

Activity: Mount Coot-tha

Mount Coot-tha is just inland of Brisbane and is a great place to visit to get out of the City for the day and enjoy the epic views. You can catch public transport from Central station to the Mount Coot-tha Lookout however this will involve 3 bus changes and takes roughly an hour. Alternatively you can catch a train from central to Toowong station and get an Uber to drop you at the start of the JC Slaughter Falls picnic area.

Mount Coot-ha has its own shuttle bus service that you can hop on and off between these stops:

* Mt Coot-tha Lookout(also Kuta Cafe and Summit Restaurant & Bar)

* Sir Samuel Griffith Drive - Mt Coot-tha Car Park

* Sir Samuel Griffith Drive - Mahogany Trail

* Sir Samuel Griffith Drive - J. C. Slaughter Falls Picnic Area

* Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha(alsoSir Thomas Brisbane Planetarium,Mt Coot-tha LibraryandMt Coot-tha Visitor Information Centre).

The shuttle runs as follows:

summer (1 October to 30 April) - 8.40am-7pm

winter (1 May to 30 September) - 9.40am-4.40pm.

Mount Coot-the Loop is a 10km hiking trail around Mount Coot-tha that is great for hiking, running or cycling. The trail has toilets and cafes dotted along the trail and passes JC Slaughter Falls, Powerful Owl trail and also the Mount Coot-tha summit where you will find the Summit Restaurant and Bar Its worth stopping even if its just for a coffee at the Kuta cafe and to take in the views.

DAY 59 : Get to know Brisbane- Museum & Anzac Square

View Image

DAY 59

Location: Brisbane

Activity: Get to know Brisbane- Museum & Anzac Square

Get to know Brisbane a little better by visiting the Museum of Brisbane. The Museum of Brisbane is located on level 3 of Brisbane City Hall in King George Square and exhibitions are free to enter so why not visit to find out a little more about Brisbanes culture and heritage.

Its a short walk from here to Anzac Square which delves into the History of the 1st and 2nd World Wars and displays a spectacular shrine of remembrance. Admission is also free.

Its a 5-10 minute walk from here to North Quay where you can jump on a CityHopper Ferry to take you along the river to get the best view of the City. The City Hopper is a free services and runs every 36 minutes to New Farm and back.

There are also other river cruises such as the Citycat and the Speedycat however these are paid services.

Head over the Victoria Bridge to the Vegan Street Markets full of healthy sweet treats, burgers, pies and more. The markets are open between 12pm and 8pm, however we recommend checking the Facebook group for any changes.

DAY 60 : River cruise

View Image

DAY 60

Location: Brisbane

Activity: River cruise

Explore the City by boat and head to North Quay where you can jump on a CityHopper Ferry to take you along the river to get the best view of the City. The City Hopper is a free services and runs every 36 minutes to New Farm and back.

There are also other river cruises such as the Citycat and the Speedycat however these are paid services.

If you have time to spare and youre looking for a slower paced experience you can book a spot on the Brisbane Lunch Cruise which is a 2 hour cruise along the river and back with an all inclusive buffet which includes a large range of main courses and deserts as well as alcoholic beverages. You can choose from soft drinks, Australian wines, beers, and a range of spirits. Prices start from $65per adult and will need to be booked in advance.

Choose between lunch, dinner or high tea cruises from Thursday-Sunday.

DAY 61 : Hiking

View Image

DAY 61

Location: Glass House Mountains

Activity: Hiking

There are lots of different mountains to climb here so make sure you check the difficulty of each mountain before you decide which one is best for you. Make sure you have everything you need before you set off, including water and suitable shoes. DO NOT do any of these in flip flops (thongs) because even one of the easiest mountains will be impossible.

The below website has some great information about the different walking tracks and the difficulty levels of each of the mountains.

Glass House Mountains

One example is Mount Beerburrum which is one of the less extreme mountains to climb, although it is still extremely steep, it is one of the shorter climbs. We recommend getting to the top in time for sunset as the views are incredible, start the climb at least an hour before sunset to allow you plenty of time to get to the top.

Before you set off make sure you check mountain closures online as currently some of the mountains are closed for resurfacing.

The Glass House Mountains are easily accessed on the train from Brisbane towards Noosa or vice versa. Mount Beerburrum is an convenient option because you can get off the train at Beerburrum station and it's around a 10 minute walk to the bottom of the mountain. the trains come every 1-1.5hours so make sure you time the trains that you plan to catch to continue your journey as there isn't anywhere else to go around the station. If you are travelling with suitcases I wouldn't recommend doing the hike unless you have accomodation to leave your belongings at.

DAY 62 : Animal Encounters

View Image

DAY 62

Location: Australia Zoo

Activity: Animal Encounters

Australia Zoo belongs to the famous Irwin family. Its an East Coast MUST DO so make sure its on your bucket list. You can get a free shuttle from Beerwah station that takes you straight to the Zoo or take a public bus, as many routes go to the Zoo directly. The opening times are 9am-5pm daily including weekends and school holidays, however these are naturally a lot busier. One of the perks of visiting during the school holidays, the Zoo hosts lots of extra seasonal activities and you are likely to see the Irwins themselves hosting crocodile feeding shows, Tigers talks and more.

An adult admission ticket is $59 and a childs' ticket is $35, you can also purchase annual passes meaning you'll save money if you plan to visit the zoo more than once.

If you're looking to get a bit closer to the animals the Zoo offers lots of different encounters meaning you can cuddle up to Tiger cubs, lemurs or get yourself an infamous koala selfie.

Australia Zoo

DAY 63 : Beach day and Boutique Shopping

View Image

DAY 63

Location: Mooloolaba

Activity: Beach day and Boutique Shopping

Mooloolaba is a beautiful beach town South of the Sunshine Coast airport, Mooloolaba is likened to Noosa, however, its a little less pricey and definitely not as busy. It seems more of a local town rather than a tourist hotspot although its perfect for a beach day on your journey along the coast.

The coastal town has lots of restaurants and cafes as well as super affordable shops!

Start the day with a coffee along the promenade and then head off to do some shopping. In the afternoon you can head to the pristine white beach that feels almost empty, its really quiet even during school holidays. The sea is calm and you can take a look in some rock pools to the far left hand side of the beach.

End the afternoon with dinner and cocktails either at The Beach Bar and Grill or Mooloolaba Surf club. Both offers beautiful beach views.

Mooloolaba is also a great place to base yourself if you plan to visit Australia Zoo or the Glass House Mountains as it's a short journey on a train or bus.

DAY 64 : Beach day and shopping trip

View Image

DAY 64

Location: Noosa

Activity: Beach day and shopping trip

Noosa is a boutique beach town, North of the Sunshine Coast Airport, that is full of coffee shops and luxury clothing stores, set amongst sprawling million dollar homes. Hastings street is the main shopping street, set metres back from the beach making it the ideal place to visit if youre looking to treat yourself a little and relax at the beach once youve done so. You can either grab a coffee on Hastings street, every coffee shop is dog friendly and you will be surrounded by pooches, or try a vegan ice-cream from Happy Pops. The peanut butter flavour is the best ice-cream Weve ever tasted! Its like ice-cream thats not cold, It's very hard to explain so you will have to taste it for youselves. If youre looking for some summer clothes have a look at Goddess clothing for some beachy bargains.

Spend the rest of the day at the beach and relax.

Once you've finished your day at the beach you can take a walk along the everglades before dinner to catch a glimpse of your future #HouseGoals.

You can get to Noosa from either Brisbane or the Sunshine Coast airport with regular buses and trains. The public transport in the area is great, it takes roughly a 1 hour from the Sunshine Coast airport by bus and costs no more than $8-10. If, however, youd rather a direct route you can book a shuttle with Con-X-ion for around $35.

DAY 65 : National Park Coastal Walk

View Image

DAY 65

Location: Noosa

Activity: National Park Coastal Walk

Visit Noosa's National Park and join one of the many walking tracks.

If youre looking for scenic views and hidden beaches take the Coastal walk. Make sure you take some water and snacks for an afternoon at one of the beach stops.

The Noosa Fairy Pools are hidden half way along the National Park Coastal track, if youre wearing sturdy footwear you can walk along the rocks to the Fairy Pools that are often empty. If you check the tide times and the tide is low you can head in for a swim whilst the waves crash in. Be super careful and stay away from the edges in particular on the right hand side. This spot can be dangerous if you are not careful, large freak waves can occasionally crash against the right side and you could be knocked in so please stay clear of any wet rocks or the edge of the rocks. If you plan to swim stick to the central path that takes you down to the narrowest part of the Fairy Pool as seen in the picture.

DAY 66 : Everglades Tour

View Image

DAY 66

Location: Noosa

Activity: Everglades Tour

Tour Noosa's famous everglades by crusie or canoe on a Cruise 'n' Canoe Habitat Noosa Tour

You'll be picked up from your accommodation in Noosa and you'll spend the day exploring the everglades by boat and canoe stopping for photos along the way. You'll stop for morning tea and a roast lunch before continuing along the everglades. At the end of the tour you'll be taken back to Noosa by shuttle.

Once your back in town head to Hastings street for dinner. If you're looking for a casual meal head to Noosa Surf Club or Betty's Burgers for a cheap eat.

If you're in the mood for something more upmarket try Miss MoneyPenny's for a relaxed atmosphere at a well known cocktail bar.

DAY 67 : 2-3 day tour

View Image

DAY 67

Location: Fraser Island

Activity: 2-3 day tour

Fraser is always an East Coast highlight for those who do it. There are different styles of tours so here are 2 options.

Cool dingos tours are either 2 or 3 days long. They are guided tours on a coach big enough for roughly 30 people. The accommodation is bunk style dorm rooms or you have the option to pay extra for a private room with a shared bathroom. We recommend the 3 day tour however if you are really tight on time the spots that are must sees are Lake Mackenzie, Eli Creek, Champagne pools and Maheno Shipwreck, all of which are covered in the 2 day tours with cool dingos.

All tours seem to cover the same spots however, some offer self drive 4x4s and camping style accommodation, one that comes recommended was Pippies if you would prefer this.

Cool Dingos Pippie's Tours

NB: These tours can pickup from Rainbow beach which is just under 2 hours north of Noosa. If you are short on time do a 2 day tour instead of 3. The best parts will be covered on the first 2 days.

DAY 68 : Boathaven Beach

View Image

DAY 68

Location: Airlie Beach

Activity: Boathaven Beach

Boathaven beach is one of the most recommended in Airlie as it has a stinger net all year round so you can swim with no need to worry and you also have a view of the marina as a backdrop. Boathaven is just a 15 minute walk from the Lagoon and just 8 minutes from the Airlie beach Hotel.

Head to lunch at the Anchor Bar and spend the afternoon at the infinity pool, sipping cocktails with a view of Hook Islands, the largest of all the Whitsundays Islands. The Anchor has a great food and drinks menu and it is a recommended spot for the evening. If you're looking for reasonably priced food then it's a really good option, the make your own cheesecake is very popular!

DAY 69 : Relax and Airlie Lagoon

View Image

DAY 69

Location: Airlie Beach

Activity: Relax and Airlie Lagoon

Airlie beach Lagoon pool is perfect to enjoy a day off of the reef. You'll find hundreds of solo travels sitting at the lagoon so if you're looking to meet people this is a great place to start. The water is warm and the lagoon has shallow areas meaning you can lay out and sunbathe in the water.

The lagoon has a smaller children's pool next to it so it's family friendly but you also dont have kids splashing around in the main pool. Some of the local restaurants such as the Treehouse and The Deck lookout across the lagoon so you can grab lunch and spend the whole day here.

In the evening head to Boatys with your new friends and meet some of the friendly locals. Boaty's has well priced food and often has evening entertainment, either karaoke or a quiz night of some kind.

DAY 70 : Whitsundays Island Tour

View Image

DAY 70

Location: Airlie Beach

Activity: Whitsundays Island Tour

There are hundreds of day tours to Whitehaven beach to choose from but a favourite amongst the locals is the Thundercats tour which spends 2 hours on Whitehaven and also takes you to 2 dive spots, this is an ideal tour for anyone who loves snorkelling/diving. Whitehaven is a very famous spot and popular film location. We recommend a tour that spends as long as possible here to fully enjoy it. Walking across the Island to the lookout points and then down to the beach could take up to 30-40minutes so head back to the beach quickly to make the most of it. Thundercats 1 day Island tour

You can also do a 2 day sail around the Whitsundays island. This is a very different style but will cover the same stops. You can either opt for a 1 or 2 night tour depending on the amount of time you have. This is a once in a life time opportunity and if you can handle the thought of sea sickness then It is highly recommended.

Its likely to be a young crowd and the tour will naturally take a slower pace between each stop as its a sailing boat rather than a fast boat. You can sunbathe on the deck of the boat and youll spend the evening sleeping there too if you like. PowerPlay is a company recommended by Happy Travels based in Airlie Beach Powerplay 2 day sailing trip

Its a once in a lifetime opportunity to sail the Whitsundays and if you have the time an overnight stay on the reef would be the cherry on top.

* If you don't think that either of these tours are quite for you there are hundreds of other options and We'd be more than happy to have a look at other options. *

DAY 71 : Relax at Hamilton Island Resorts

View Image

DAY 71

Location: Hamilton island

Activity: Relax at Hamilton Island Resorts

Hamilton Island is the peak of luxury. An adult only resorts and hotel rooms with views of the 74 Whitsundays Islands, what more could you ask for? Hamilton Islands is a great destination for a Honeymoon or a special occasion but at the same time it's definitely an expensive trip and if you're on a budget you're not missing too much if you chose to to stay on the main land and spend your trip doing day trips out to the Islands. Average price per night during the summer is 175-225. Booked 3 months in advance.

If you decide to stay on the mainland you can get the Ferry to Hamilton Island to explore the beauty spot but be warned it comes at a price. A return Ferry trip costs $137! It's an expensive day trip but once you arrive you can visit the resorts and of course relax on the main beach. In all honesty if you would like to visit Hamilton Island I recommend a day tour to Whitehaven beach with an additional stop at Hamilton in the afternoon.

DAY 72 : Barbie Cars and Beaches

View Image

DAY 72

Location: Magnetic Island

Activity: Barbie Cars and Beaches

Magnetic Island is a 12km island off the coast of Townsville. You can get the Ferry from Townsville Wharf which takes roughly 30 minutes. You can book a return ticket for $30pp if you book online. You can book on the day however make sure you arrive early enough to catch the Ferry you intend to as the queues can get long.

Once you arrive on Magnetic Island hire one of the famous Topless Barbie Cars and take a drive around the island. You can hire these cars from $80 per day. Take a drive to one of the many beaches on the island, start at Horseshoe Bay as it has stinger nets set up which means you will be able to swim without a stinger suit. Its important to note that you should avoid swimming without a stinger suit or nets whilst in North Queensland.

Once youve finished swimming start the walk towards either Radical Bay or Balding Bay, 2 of the prettiest beaches on the island.

There are plenty of restaurants to choose from on the Island, two of the favourites are Up The Garden Path (reasonable prices and a range of cheaper or more expensive bites) and Boardwalk Restaurant and Bar(More expensive option, steaks and seafood platters).

DAY 73 : Hiking and Biking

View Image

DAY 73

Location: Magnetic Island

Activity: Hiking and Biking

For your second day on the island you can enjoy some of the walking trails. One of the most popular trails is the Forts walk, its roughly 4km and will take between 1hour and 90 minutes depending on your pace. The Nelly Bay to Arcadia walk is also a popular one as you get a view from the top overlooking Horseshoe Bay.

If youre feeling like more of a challenge you can do the 16km trek from Picnic Bay to West Point on the western side of the island. The landscape is very different on the western side, youll find mangroves and wetlands so make sure you are wearing sturdy footwear.

If you prefer to explore the island by bike you can hire the from Magnetic Island Bike Hire for $25 for 24 hours. Cycle around the Island stopping at Arthur Bay, Geoffrey Bay and Florence Bay for more beach time.

Head for lunch at Le Paradis, SOS or Thai Again which are all in the area of the Ferry Port before boarding back to Townsville.

DAY 74 : Diving Great Barrier Reef

View Image

DAY 74

Location: Cairns

Activity: Diving Great Barrier Reef

Whether you have dived before or not, youre on the Great Barrier Reef and you should definitely give it a go. You can book guided dives if your PADI certified or discovery dives if you have never dived before. A discovery dive will cost around $240 for a full day on the reef and you will be able to dive to 6metres and get a feel for life on the reef. Look out for turtles, stingers and possible even some reef sharks.

For those who are experienced divers you can also book full day tours on the reef for all different levels also at Cairns Diving .

DAY 75 : Explore the markets and Bar Crawl

View Image

DAY 75

Location: Cairns

Activity: Explore the markets and Bar Crawl

Spend the day at the Cairns Lagoon. Much like Airlie Beach and Brisbane, Cairns has a man-made Lagoon right by the ocean where you can relax all day before heading out on one of Cairns famous bar crawls.

Start the evening by heading to check out the Cairns night markets, they have some crazy bargains here as well as pamper sessions and massages.

After some browsing at the markets go to the Woolshed for dinner and some table dancing before slowly making your way through all the bars in town and finishing the night at Gilligans, Cairns best Hostel for nightlife.

DAY 76 : White water rafting

View Image

DAY 76

Location: Cairns

Activity: White water rafting

One of the most popular activities in Cairns is White Water Rafting. Book a half day tour with Foaming Fury and spend 2 full hours rafting along Barron river. You will be picked up from Cairns and driven 20 minutes to the Barron River where you will be given your equipment and taught some of the things youll need to know on the river. The Barron River has grade 3 rapids which is suitable for beginners. Prices start from $145.

If you like the sound of White water rafting but youre on a tighter budget you could book a river tubing trip on the Mulgrave river for $90. Again you will be picked up from Cairns and dropped back again. This experience will be roughly 4 and a half hours.

You will need to take a towel, a change of clothes, suncream and some water.

Youve worked up an appetite so treat yourself to a nice dinner at the Salt Housewhich offers one of the best seats in town. Right on the marina, they serve lunch and dinner and you can choose from the Bar, restaurant or pizzeria. This is the go-to for locals as its such a great location.

DAY 77 : Bungy Jump and Jungle Swing

View Image

DAY 77

Location: Cairns

Activity: Bungy Jump and Jungle Swing

Cairns is a bit of an adventure hot spot and is home to an AJ Hackett skypark. You can choose from Bungy jumping or the giant jungle swing, or of course do both! The bungy jump is 50m high and its the only place you can bungy in Australia. Choose form 16 different ways to jump from Cairns only viewing platform with a view of the Northern Beaches. Bungy jump prices start from $179.

If youve bungy jumped before and youre looking to do something different you can instead test out the Giant Jungle swing that drops from 45m with a self release pully to set you flying at speeds reaching 120km and hour. Prices for the swing start from $129 and include free transport from your accommodation.

If youre really feeling adventurous you can do both for a bundle price of $269.

Once youve finished being a daredevil youre going to need something to celebrate so head to Flamingos Tiki Bar for some cocktails and a great atmosphere to keep your buzz going.

DAY 78 : Kuranda Scenic Railway

View Image

DAY 78

Location: Cairns

Activity: Kuranda Scenic Railway

Kuranda Scenic Railway is a popular day trip in to the Rainforest. You can book a round trip on the Kuranda Railway or alternatively you can opt for the Skyrail gondola one way so you get to experience both. Once you arrive in Kuranda you can visit the brightly coloured village markets, Rainforest Nature Park or the Kuranda Koala Gardens. Its recommended that you allow 2-3hours in Kuranda before taking the scenic journey back to Cairns.

The railway and the skyrail each take an hour and a half, you can choose which route you take there and back and you can also book pick up and return transfers from your Cairns accommodation from a total of $130.
